name: QUIJANO
line: Good evening. From Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia, and welcome to the first, and only, vice presidential debate of 2016, sponsored by the Commission on Presidential Debates.

name: KAINE
line: Elaine, thank you for being here tonight, and, Governor Pence, welcome. It is so great to be back at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia.

name: QUIJANO
line: Governor Pence?

name: PENCE
line: Well, first off, thank you, Elaine, and thank you to — thank you to Norwood University for their wonderful hospitality and the Commission on Presidential Debates. It’s deeply humbling for me to be here, to be surrounded by my — my wonderful family.

name: QUIJANO
line: Senator Kaine, on the campaign trail, you praised Secretary Clinton’s character, including her commitment to public service, yet 60 percent of voters don’t think she’s trustworthy. Why do so many people distrust her? Is it because they have questions about her e-mails and the Clinton Foundation?

name: KAINE
line: Elaine, let me tell you why I trust Hillary Clinton. Here’s what people should look at as they look at a public servant. Do they have a passion in their life that showed up before they were in public life? And have they held onto that passion throughout their life, regardless of whether they were in office or not, succeeding or failing?

name: QUIJANO
line: Governor Pence, let me ask you, you have said Donald Trump is, quote, “thoughtful, compassionate, and steady.” Yet 67 percent of voters feel he is a risky choice, and 65 percent feel he does not have the right kind of temperament to be president. Why do so many Americans think Mr. Trump is simply too erratic?

name: PENCE
line: Well, let me — let me say first and foremost that, Senator, you and Hillary Clinton would know a lot about an insult-driven campaign. It really is remarkable. At a time when literally, in the wake of Hillary Clinton’s tenure as secretary of state, where she was the architect of the Obama administration’s foreign policy, we see entire portions of the world, particularly the wider Middle East, literally spinning out of control. I mean, the situation we’re watching hour by hour in Syria today is the result of the failed foreign policy and the weak foreign policy that Hillary Clinton helped lead in this administration and create. The newly emboldened — the aggression of Russia, whether it was in Ukraine or now their heavy-handed approach…

name: KAINE
line: You guys love Russia. You both have said…

name: PENCE
line: … their heavy-handed approach.

name: KAINE
line: You both have said — you both have said Vladimir Putin is a better leader than the president.

name: PENCE
line: Well…[crosstalk]

name: QUIJANO
line: Well, we’re going to get to Russia in just a moment. But I do want to get back to the question at…

name: PENCE
line: But in the midst — Elaine, thank you. Thank you. Thank you, Senator, I’ll…

name: KAINE
line: These guys have praised Vladimir Putin as a great leader. How can that…[crosstalk]

name: QUIJANO
line: Yes, and we will get to that, Senator. We do have that coming up here. But in the meantime, the questions…

name: PENCE
line: Well, Senator, I must have hit a…[crosstalk]…I must have hit a nerve here.

name: QUIJANO
line: Why the disconnect?

name: PENCE
line: Because at a time of great challenge in the life of this nation, where we’ve weakened America’s place in the world, stifled America’s economy, the campaign of Hillary Clinton and Tim Kaine has been an avalanche of insults.

name: KAINE
line: And paid few taxes and lost a billion a year.

name: QUIJANO
line: And why the disconnect with your running mate?

name: PENCE
line: But there’s a — there’s a reason why people question the trustworthiness of Hillary Clinton. And that’s because they’re paying attention. I mean, the reality is, when she was secretary of state, Senator, come on. She had a Clinton Foundation accepting contributions from foreign governments.

name: KAINE
line: You are Donald Trump’s apprentice. Let me talk about this…[crosstalk]

name: PENCE
line: Senator, I think I’m still on my time.

name: KAINE
line: Well, I think — isn’t this a discussion?

name: QUIJANO
line: This is our open discussion.

name: KAINE
line: Yeah, let’s talk about the state of…[crosstalk]

name: PENCE
line: Well, let me interrupt — let me interrupt you and finish my sentence, if I can.

name: KAINE
line: Finish your sentence.

name: PENCE
line: The Clinton Foundation accepted foreign contributions from foreign governments and foreign donors while she was secretary of state.

name: KAINE
line: OK, now I can weigh in. Now…

name: PENCE
line: She had a private server…

name: KAINE
line: Now, I get to weigh in. Now, let me just say this…

name: PENCE
line: … that was discovered…[crosstalk]

name: QUIJANO
line: … Senator, you have an opportunity to respond.

name: PENCE
line: … keep that pay to play process out of the reach of the public.

name: KAINE
line: Governor Pence — Governor Pence doesn’t think the world’s going so well and he, you know, is going to say it’s everybody’s fault.

name: PENCE
line: Do you?

name: KAINE
line: Let me tell you this. When Hillary Clinton became secretary of state, Governor Pence, do you know that Osama bin Laden was alive?

name: PENCE
line: Yes.

name: KAINE
line: Do you know that we had 175,000 troops deployed in the battlefield in Iraq and Afghanistan? Do you know that Iran was racing toward a nuclear weapon and Russia was expanding its stockpile?

name: PENCE
line: Eliminate the Iranian nuclear weapons program?

name: KAINE
line: Absolutely, without firing a shot. And instead of 175,000 American troops deployed overseas, we now have 15,000.

name: PENCE
line: Right and…

name: KAINE
line: These are very, very good things.

name: PENCE
line: And Iraq has been overrun by ISIS, because Hillary Clinton failed to renegotiate…

name: KAINE
line: Well, if you want to put more American troops in Iraq, you can propose that.

name: PENCE
line: Hillary Clinton — Hillary Clinton — Hillary Clinton failed to renegotiate a status of forces agreement…

name: KAINE
line: No, that is incorrect. That’s incorrect.

name: PENCE
line: And so we removed — we removed all of our…

name: QUIJANO
line: Gentlemen, we’ll get to…[crosstalk]

name: PENCE
line: … troops from Iraq, and ISIS was able to be conjured up in that vacuum.

name: KAINE
line: But I’d like to correct…

name: PENCE
line: … and overrun vast areas of Iraq.

name: KAINE
line: Governor, President Bush said we would leave Iraq at the end of 2011. And, Elaine, Iraq didn’t want our troops to stay, and they wouldn’t give us the protection for our troops. And guess what? If a nation where our troops are serving does not want us to stay, we’re not going to stay without their protection.

name: PENCE
line: It was a failure of the secretary of state…

name: QUIJANO
line: We need to move on to the next topic, gentlemen.

name: KAINE
line: If Governor Pence wants to put more troops back in Iraq, that’s…

name: QUIJANO
line: There are a lot of people wondering in this country about the economy. Let’s turn to the issue of the economy.

name: KAINE
line: OK.

name: QUIJANO
line: According to the nonpartisan Committee for a Responsible Federal Budget, neither of your economic plans will reduce the growing $19 trillion gross national debt. In fact, your plans would add even more to it.

name: PENCE
line: I think the fact that — that under this past administration of which Hillary Clinton was a part, we’ve almost doubled the national debt is atrocious. I mean, I’m very proud of the fact that — I come from a state that works. The state of Indiana has balanced budgets. We cut taxes, we’ve made record investments in education and in infrastructure, and I still finish my term with $2 billion in the bank.

name: QUIJANO
line: Senator Kaine?

name: KAINE
line: Elaine, on the economy, there’s a fundamental choice for the American electorate. Do you want a “you’re hired” president in Hillary Clinton or do you want a “you’re fired” president in Donald Trump? I think that’s not such a hard choice.

name: QUIJANO
line: On that point, Governor Pence, recently the New York Times released part of Mr. Trump’s 1995 tax return and reported that he could have avoided paying federal income taxes for years. Yesterday, Mr. Trump said he brilliantly used the laws to pay as little tax as legally possible. Does that seem fair to you?

name: PENCE
line: Well, first, let me say, I appreciated the “you’re hired,” “you’re fired” thing, Senator. You use that a whole lot. And I think your running mate used a lot of pre-done lines.

name: KAINE
line: Fifteen million new jobs?

name: PENCE
line: … slowest economic recovery since the Great Depression.

name: KAINE
line: Fifteen million new jobs?

name: QUIJANO
line: Governor…[crosstalk]

name: PENCE
line: There are millions more people living in poverty today than the day that Barack Obama with Hillary Clinton at his side…

name: KAINE
line: And the poverty level and the median income…

name: PENCE
line: … stepped into the Oval Office.

name: KAINE
line: … improved dramatically between 2014 and 2015.

name: PENCE
line: You — honestly, Senator, you can roll out the numbers and the sunny side, but I got to tell you, people in Scranton know different. People in Fort Wayne, Indiana, know different. I mean, this economy is struggling. The answer to this economy is not more taxes.

name: KAINE
line: But it’s not the giveaway tax relief to the folks at the top.

name: PENCE
line: It’s not more spending…[crosstalk]

name: KAINE
line: I am interested to hear whether he’ll defend his running mate’s not releasing taxes and not paying taxes.

name: PENCE
line: Absolutely I will.

name: QUIJANO
line: Governor, with all due respect, the question was about whether it seems fair to you that Mr. Trump said he brilliantly used the laws to pay as little tax as legally possible.

name: PENCE
line: Well, this is probably the difference between Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton and Senator Kaine. And, I mean, Hillary Clinton and Senator Kaine — God bless you for it, career public servants, that’s great — Donald Trump is a businessman, not a career politician. He actually built a business.

name: KAINE
line: But why won’t he release his tax returns?

name: PENCE
line: Well, we’re answering the question about — about a business thing, is he…

name: KAINE
line: I do want to come back to that, but…

name: PENCE
line: His tax returns — his tax returns showed he went through a very difficult time, but he used the tax code just the way it’s supposed to be used. And he did it brilliantly.

name: KAINE
line: How do you know that? You haven’t seen his tax returns.

name: PENCE
line: He created a runway — because he’s created a business that’s worth billions of dollars today.

name: KAINE
line: How do you know that?

name: PENCE
line: And with regard to paying taxes, this whole riff about not paying taxes and people saying he didn’t pay taxes for years, Donald Trump has created tens of thousands of jobs. And he’s paid payroll taxes, sales taxes, property taxes…

name: KAINE
line: Elaine, let me talk about something.

name: QUIJANO
line: Senator, I’m going to give you about 30 seconds to respond, and I have question on Social Security for you.

name: KAINE
line: OK.

name: PENCE
line: The only issue on taxes — Hillary Clinton is going to raise taxes, and Donald Trump and I are going to cut them.

name: KAINE
line: Donald Trump started this campaign in 2014 and he said, “If I run for president, I will absolutely release my taxes.” He’s broken his first…

name: PENCE
line: And he will.

name: KAINE
line: He’s broken his first promise. Second, he stood on the stage…

name: PENCE
line: He hasn’t broken his promise. He said he’s…

name: KAINE
line: He stood on the stage last week and when Hillary said, you haven’t been paying taxes, he said, “That makes me smart.” So it’s smart not to pay for our military? It’s smart not to pay for veterans? It’s smart not to pay for teachers? And I guess all of us who do pay for those things, I guess we’re stupid. And the last thing I’ll say is this…

name: PENCE
line: Senator, do you take all the deductions that you’re entitled to?

name: KAINE
line: The last thing — the last thing I want to ask Governor Pence is…

name: PENCE
line: I do.

name: KAINE
line: Governor Pence had to give Donald Trump his tax returns to show he was qualified to be vice president. Donald Trump must give the American public his tax returns to show that he’s qualified to be president. And he’s breaking his promise.

name: PENCE
line: Elaine, I have to respond to this.

name: QUIJANO
line: You get very little time, 20 seconds.

name: PENCE
line: I’ll be — I’ll be very respectful.

name: QUIJANO
line: Governor?

name: PENCE
line: Look, Donald Trump has filed over 100 pages of financial disclosure, which is what the law requires.

name: KAINE
line: But he said he would release his tax returns.

name: QUIJANO
line: All right, Gentlemen…

name: PENCE
line: The American people can review that. And he’s going — Senator, he’s going to release his tax returns when the audit is over…

name: QUIJANO
line: … I need to ask you about Social Security…

name: KAINE
line: Richard Nixon released tax returns when he was under audit.

name: PENCE
line: They’re going to raise your taxes. We’re going to cut your taxes.

name: QUIJANO
line: Gentlemen…

name: KAINE
line: If you can’t meet Nixon’s standard…

name: QUIJANO
line: The people at home cannot understand either one of you when you speak over each other. I would please ask you to wait until it is that the other is finished.

name: KAINE
line: All right. We’re having fun up here.

name: QUIJANO
line: Senator Kaine, on the issue of Social Security, in 18 years, when the Social Security Trust Funds run out of money, you’ll be 76. The Committee for a Responsible Federal Budget estimates your benefits could be cut by as much as $7,500 per year. What would your administration do to prevent this cut?

name: KAINE
line: First, we’re going to protect Social Security, which is one of the greatest programs that the American government has ever done. It happened at a time when you would work your whole life, your whole life, raising your kids, working, being a Little League coach or a Sunday school teacher, and then you would retire into poverty. And Social Security has enabled people to retire with dignity and overwhelmingly not be in poverty.

name: QUIJANO
line: Governor Pence, I’ll give you an opportunity to respond.

name: PENCE
line: Well, thanks, Elaine. There they go again. OK…

name: KAINE
line: Go read — go read the book.

name: PENCE
line: All Donald Trump — all Donald Trump and I have said about Social Security is we’re going to meet our obligations to our seniors. That’s it.

name: KAINE
line: Go read the book.

name: PENCE
line: We’ve said we’re going to meet the obligations of Medicare. That’s what this campaign is really about, Senator. And I get, this is — this is the old scare tactic that they roll out…

name: KAINE
line: But — but you have a voting record, Governor.

name: PENCE
line: And I get all of that. I just, look…

name: KAINE
line: I…

name: PENCE
line: There’s a question that you asked a little bit earlier that I want to go back to.

name: KAINE
line: I can’t believe that you won’t defend your own voting record.

name: PENCE
line: I have to go back to.

name: QUIJANO
line: We…

name: PENCE
line: Well, look, I — you’re running with Hillary Clinton, who wants to raise taxes by $1 trillion, increase spending by $2 trillion, and you say you’re going to keep the promises of Social Security. Donald Trump and I are going to cut taxes. We’re going to — we’re going to — we’re going to…

name: KAINE
line: You’re not going to cut taxes. You’re going to raise taxes on the middle class.

name: PENCE
line: … reform government programs so we can meet the obligations of Social Security and Medicare.

name: QUIJANO
line: All right. PENCE: Stay on the path that your party has us on, we’re going to be in a — in a mountain range of debt. And we’re going to face hard choices and…[crosstalk]

name: KAINE
line: You did ask this question about debt, and the debt explosion on the Trump plan is much, much bigger than anything on the Clinton side.

name: QUIJANO
line: All right. Let me move on now…

name: PENCE
line: Three hundred and five economists said your plan is bad for the economy.

name: QUIJANO
line: … to the issue of law enforcement and race relations. Law enforcement and race relations. After the Dallas police shooting, Police Chief David Brown said, quote, “We’re asking cops to do too much in this country. Every societal failure we put it off on the cops to solve. Not enough mental health funding, not enough drug addiction funding, schools fail, let’s give it to the cops.”

name: KAINE
line: Elaine, I think that’s a very fair comment. I think we put a lot on police shoulders. And this is something I got a lot of scar tissue and experience on.

name: QUIJANO
line: Governor Pence?

name: PENCE
line: You know, my uncle was a cop, a career cop, on the beat in downtown Chicago. He was my hero when I was growing up. And we’d go up to visit my dad’s family in Chicago. My three brothers and I would marvel at my uncle when he would come out in his uniform, sidearm at his side.

name: KAINE
line: Can I — can I explain…

name: PENCE
line: … I just think what we ought to do is we ought to stop seizing on these moments of tragedy. We ought to assure the public that we’ll have a full and complete and transparent investigation whenever there’s a loss of life because of police action. But, Senator, please, you know, enough of this seeking every opportunity to demean law enforcement broadly by making the accusation of implicit bias every time tragedy occurs.

name: KAINE
line: Elaine — Elaine, people shouldn’t be afraid to bring up issues of bias in law enforcement. And if you’re afraid to have…

name: PENCE
line: I’m not afraid to bring that up.

name: KAINE
line: And if — if you’re afraid to have the discussion, you’ll never solve it. And so here’s — here’s an example, heartbreaking. We would agree this is a heartbreaking example.

name: PENCE
line: We need criminal justice reform.

name: KAINE
line: Well, we do.

name: PENCE
line: Indiana has passed criminal justice reform.

name: KAINE
line: But I just want to say, those who say that we should not…

name: PENCE
line: But that’s not what you’re talking about.

name: KAINE
line: … we should not be able to bring up and talk about bias in the system, we’ll never solve the problem…

name: QUIJANO
line: Governor Pence…[crosstalk]…Governor Pence…

name: PENCE
line: Senator, when African-American police officers involved in a police action shooting involving an African-American, why would Hillary Clinton accuse that African-American police officer of implicit bias?

name: KAINE
line: Well, I guess I can’t believe you are defending the position that there is no bias and it’s a topic we don’t even…[crosstalk]

name: QUIJANO
line: Governor Pence, I have a question on that point.

name: PENCE
line: I did not make that statement. I…

name: QUIJANO
line: Your fellow Republican, Governor Pence, Senator Tim Scott, who is African-American, recently spoke on the Senate floor. He said he was stopped seven times by law enforcement in one year.

name: KAINE
line: A U.S. senator.

name: QUIJANO
line: He said, “I have felt the anger, the frustration, the sadness, and the humiliation that comes with feeling like you’re being targeted for nothing more than being just yourself.” What would you say to Senator Scott about his experiences?

name: PENCE
line: Well, I have the deepest respect for Senator Scott, and he’s a close friend. And what I would say is that we — we need to adopt criminal justice reform nationally. I — I signed criminal justice reform in the state of Indiana, Senator, and we’re very proud of it.

name: KAINE
line: Elaine, can I…

name: QUIJANO
line: So what would you say to Senator Scott, Governor?

name: PENCE
line: Law enforcement in this country is a force for good. They are the — they truly are people that put their lives on the line every single day. But I would — I would suggest to you, what we need to do is assert a stronger leadership at the national level to support law enforcement. You just heard Senator Kaine reject stop-and-frisk. Well, I would suggest to you that the families that live in our inner cities that are besieged by crime…

name: KAINE
line: Elaine, let me — let me…

name: QUIJANO
line: Governor, the question is about Senator Scott. What would — what would you tell Senator Scott?

name: KAINE
line: Elaine, if I could — if I could jump in. I’ve heard Senator Scott make that eloquent plea. And look, criminal justice is about respecting the law and being respected by the law. So there is a fundamental respect issue here.

name: QUIJANO
line: All right. I want to turn to our next segment now, immigration. Your running mates have both said that undocumented immigrants who have committed violent crimes should be deported. What would you tell the millions of undocumented immigrants who have not committed violent crimes? Governor Pence?

name: PENCE
line: Donald Trump’s laid out a plan to end illegal immigration once and for all in this country. We’ve been talking it to death for 20 years. Hillary Clinton and Tim Kaine want to continue the policies of open borders, amnesty, catch and release, sanctuary cities, all the things that are driving — that are driving wages down in this country, Senator, and also too often with criminal aliens in the country, it’s bringing heartbreak.

name: KAINE
line: These were Donald’s — hold on a second, Governor.

name: PENCE
line: It’s my time, Senator.

name: QUIJANO
line: It is, in fact, the governor’s time.

name: KAINE
line: I apologize. It’s your two minutes. I apologize.

name: PENCE
line: Thanks. I forgive you. He says ours is an insult-driven campaign. Did you all just hear that? Ours is an insult-driven campaign?

name: QUIJANO
line: Governor…

name: PENCE
line: That’s small potatoes compared to Hillary Clinton…

name: QUIJANO
line: Senator Kaine?

name: PENCE
line: …. calling half of Donald Trump’s supporters a basket of deplorables.

name: KAINE
line: Hillary Clinton said something on the campaign trail, and the very next day, she said, you know what, I shouldn’t have said that.

name: PENCE
line: She said she shouldn’t have said half.

name: QUIJANO
line: Governor, this is Senator Kaine’s two minutes, please.

name: KAINE
line: Yeah, that’s right, so now we’re even.

name: PENCE
line: Yeah. [laughter]

name: KAINE
line: Look for Donald Trump apologizing to John McCain for saying he wasn’t a hero…

name: PENCE
line: Oh…

name: KAINE
line: … to Donald Trump apologizing for calling women slobs, pigs, dogs, disgusting.

name: PENCE
line: She apologized for saying “half.”

name: QUIJANO
line: Governor. It is his two minutes, please.

name: KAINE
line: Did Donald Trump apologize for taking after somebody in a Twitter war and making fun of her weight? Did he apologize for saying African-Americans are living in Hell? Did he apologize for saying President Obama was not even a citizen of the United States? You will look in vain to see Donald Trump ever taking responsibility for anybody and apologizing.

name: PENCE
line: That’s nonsense. That’s nonsense.

name: KAINE
line: I cannot believe that Governor Pence would sit here and defend his running mate’s claim that we should create a deportation force to — so that they’ll all be gone.

name: PENCE
line: Senator, we have a deportation force. It’s called Immigrations and Customs Enforcement. And the union for Immigrations and Customs Enforcement for the first time in their history endorsed Donald Trump to be the next president of the United States of America.

name: KAINE
line: So you like the 16 million deportations?

name: PENCE
line: Senator, that’s — that’s nonsense. Look, what you just heard is they have a plan for open borders, amnesty. That’s…[crosstalk]

name: KAINE
line: Our plan is like Ronald Reagan’s plan from 1986.

name: PENCE
line: They call it comprehensive immigration reform — they call it comprehensive immigration reform on Capitol Hill. We all know the routine. It’s amnesty. And you heard one of the last things he mentioned was border security.

name: KAINE
line: No, I…

name: PENCE
line: They always say we’re going to do this, we’re going to do that, we’ll eventually get the border…[crosstalk]

name: KAINE
line: … border security three years ago, and Governor Pence was against it.

name: QUIJANO
line: Governor, Mr. Trump has said…

name: PENCE
line: Ronald Reagan said a nation without borders is not a nation. Donald Trump is committed to restoring the borders of this nation and securing our nation, enforcing our laws.

name: QUIJANO
line: So, Governor, how would these millions of undocumented immigrants leave? Would they be forcibly removed?

name: PENCE
line: Well, I think Donald Trump laid out a series of priorities that doesn’t ends with border security. It begins with border security. And after we secure the border, not only build a wall, but beneath the ground and in the air, we do internal enforcement.

name: KAINE
line: I just have to correct Governor Pence….

name: PENCE
line: … where people can come into this country.

name: KAINE
line: I have to…

name: PENCE
line: That’s the order that you should do it. Border security, removing criminal aliens, upholding with law, and then — but then, Senator, I’ll work you when you go back to the Senate, I promise you, we’ll work with you to reform the immigration system.

name: KAINE
line: I look forward to working together in whatever capacities we serve in. But I just want to make it very, very clear that he’s trying to fuzz up what Donald Trump has said. When Donald Trump spoke in Phoenix, he looked the audience in the eye and he said, no, we’re building a wall, and we’re deporting everybody. He said, quote, “They will all be gone.” “They will all be gone.” And this is one of these ones where you can just go to the tape on it and see what Donald Trump has said. And to add…

name: PENCE
line: He’s talking about criminal aliens.

name: KAINE
line: And to add to it, and to add to it, and to add to it, we are a nation of immigrants. Mike Pence and I both are descended from immigrant families. Some things, you know, maybe weren’t said so great about the Irish when they came, but we’ve done well by absorbing immigrants, and it’s made our nation stronger.

name: QUIJANO
line: Gentleman, I’d like to shift now to the threat of terrorism. Do you think the world today is a safer or more dangerous place than it was eight years ago? Has the terrorist threat increased or decreased? Senator Kaine?

name: KAINE
line: The terrorist threat has decreased in some ways, because bin Laden is dead. The terrorist threat has decreased in some ways because an Iranian nuclear weapons program has been stopped. The terrorist threat to United States troops has been decreased in some ways because there’s not 175,000 in a dangerous part of the world. There’s only 15,000.

name: PENCE
line: Oh, please. Come on.

name: KAINE
line: … and Saddam Hussein. And last and most dangerously, Donald Trump believes — Donald Trump believes that the world will be safer if more nations have nuclear weapons. He’s said Saudi Arabia should get them, Japan should get them, Korea should get them. And when he was confronted with this, and told, wait a minute, terrorists could get those, proliferation could lead to nuclear war, here’s what Donald Trump said, and I quote: “Go ahead, folks, enjoy yourselves.”

name: QUIJANO
line: Governor Pence?

name: PENCE
line: Did you work on that one a long time? Because that had a lot of really creative lines in it.

name: KAINE
line: Well, I’m going to see if you can defend any of it.

name: PENCE
line: Well, look, I can defend — I — I — I can — I can make very clear to the American people, after traveling millions of miles as our secretary of state, after being the architect of the foreign policy of this administration, America is less safe today than it was the day that Barack Obama became president of the United States. It’s absolutely inarguable.

name: KAINE
line: I was in Virginia where the Pentagon’s…[crosstalk]

name: PENCE
line: I know you were. We all lived through that day as a nation. It was heartbreaking. And I want to give this president credit for bringing Osama bin Laden to justice.

name: KAINE
line: Stopping a nuclear weapons program without firing a shot?

name: PENCE
line: You didn’t stop the nuclear weapons program.

name: KAINE
line: Yes, we did.

name: PENCE
line: You essentially…

name: KAINE
line: Even the Israeli military says it stopped.

name: PENCE
line: … guaranteed that Iran will someday become a nuclear power, because there’s no limitations once the period of time of the treaty comes off.

name: QUIJANO
line: Governor Pence, Mr. Trump has proposed extreme vetting of immigrants from parts of the world that export terrorism. But that does not address many of the recent terrorist attacks in the United States, such as the Orlando nightclub massacre and the recent bombings in New York and New Jersey. Those were homegrown, committed by U.S. citizens and legal residents. What specific tools would you use to prevent those kinds of attacks?

name: PENCE
line: Well, I think it’s — I think it’s a great question, Elaine, but it really does begin with us reforming our immigration system and putting the interests, particularly the safety and security of the American people, first.

name: KAINE
line: Elaine, I want to…[crosstalk]

name: QUIJANO
line: Governor, the question was about homegrown.

name: PENCE
line: Yeah, and so — but first, you know, let’s make sure we’re putting the safety and security of the American people first instead of Hillary Clinton expanding the Syrian refugee program…

name: KAINE
line: Or instead of you violating the Constitution by blocking people based on their national origin rather than whether they’re dangerous.

name: PENCE
line: That’s not — that’s absolutely false.

name: KAINE
line: That’s what the Seventh Circuit decided just — here’s the difference, Elaine.

name: PENCE
line: The Seventh Circuit…

name: KAINE
line: We have different views on — on refugee issues and on immigration. Hillary and I want to do enforcement based on, are people dangerous? These guys say all Mexicans are bad.

name: PENCE
line: That’s absolutely false.

name: KAINE
line: And with respect to refugees, we want to keep people out if they’re dangerous. Donald Trump said keep them out if they’re Muslim. Mike Pence…

name: PENCE
line: Absolutely…

name: KAINE
line: … put a program in place to keep them out if they’re from Syria. And yesterday an appellate court with three Republican judges struck down the Pence plan…

name: PENCE
line: Right. Right.

name: KAINE
line: … and said it was discriminatory…

name: PENCE
line: And those judges — those judges said…

name: KAINE
line: We should focus upon danger, not upon discrimination.

name: QUIJANO
line: Governor?

name: PENCE
line: Elaine, to your point, those judges said it was because there wasn’t any evidence yet that — that ISIS had infiltrated the United States. Well, Germany just arrested three Syrian refugees that were connected to ISIS.

name: KAINE
line: But they told you there’s a right way and a wrong way to do it.

name: PENCE
line: But, look, if you’re going to be critical of me on that, that’s fair game. I will tell you, after two Syrian refugees were involved in the attack in Paris that is called Paris’ 9/11, as governor of the state of Indiana, I have no higher priority than the safety and security of the people of my state.

name: KAINE
line: But, Governor Pence…

name: PENCE
line: So you bet I suspended that program.

name: KAINE
line: But, Governor Pence, I just…

name: PENCE
line: And I stand by that decision. And if I’m vice president of the United States or Donald Trump is president, we’re going to put the safety and security of the American people first.

name: KAINE
line: Sure. Can we just be clear — Hillary and I will do immigration enforcement and we’ll vet refugees based on whether they’re dangerous or not. We won’t do it based on discriminating against you from the country you come from or the religion that you practice.

name: PENCE
line: But the problem with that…

name: KAINE
line: That is completely antithetical to the Jeffersonian values of…[crosstalk]

name: PENCE
line: Elaine, the director of the FBI, our homeland security, said we can’t know for certain who these people are coming from Syria.

name: KAINE
line: Yes, we can, and when we don’t let them know, we don’t let them in.

name: PENCE
line: So — the FBI…

name: KAINE
line: When we don’t know who they are, we don’t let them in.

name: PENCE
line: The FBI and homeland security said we can’t know for certain. You’ve got to err on the side of the safety and security of the American people, Senator. I understand the…

name: KAINE
line: By trashing all Syrians or trashing all Muslims?

name: PENCE
line: … the U.N. wants us to expand the Syrian refugee program…

name: QUIJANO
line: Senator Kaine, let me ask you this. Secretary Clinton…

name: PENCE
line: We’re going to put the safety and security of the American people first.

name: QUIJANO
line: … has talked about an intelligence surge.

name: KAINE
line: Yes.

name: QUIJANO
line: What exactly would an intelligence surge look like? And how would that help identify terrorists with no operational connection to a foreign terrorist organization?

name: KAINE
line: Intelligence surge is two things, Elaine. It’s two things. It’s, first, dramatically expanding our intelligence capacities by hiring great professionals, but also we’ve got some of the best intel and cyber employees in the world right here in the United States working for many of our private sector companies.

name: PENCE
line: That’s not his plan. KAINE: Well, he said NATO is obsolete. And, look, if you put aside — push aside your alliances, who you’re going to share intelligence with? Hillary Clinton is the secretary of state who knows how to build alliances. She built the sanctions regime around the world that stopped the Iranian nuclear weapons program. And that’s what an intelligence surge means. Better skill and capacity, but also better alliances.

name: QUIJANO
line: All right. I’d like to turn now to the tragedy in Syria. Two hundred fifty thousand…

name: PENCE
line: Can I speak about the cybersecurity surge at all?

name: QUIJANO
line: You can — you can have 30 seconds, Governor, quickly, please.

name: PENCE
line: First, Donald Trump just spoke about this issue this week. We have got to bring together the best resources of this country to understand that cyber warfare is the new warfare of the asymmetrical enemies that we face in this country. And I look forward if I’m privileged to be in this role of working with you in the Senate to make sure that we resource that effort.

name: KAINE
line: We will work together in whatever roles we inhabit.

name: PENCE
line: We have an intelligence, sir. But I will also tell you that it’s important in this moment to remember that Hillary Clinton had a private server in her home that had classified information on it…

name: QUIJANO
line: And I don’t — 30 seconds is on up.

name: PENCE
line: … about drone strikes, e-mails from the president of the United States of America were on there.

name: QUIJANO
line: Right.

name: PENCE
line: Her private server was subject to being hacked by foreign…[crosstalk]

name: QUIJANO
line: I’d like to ask you about Syria, Governor.

name: PENCE
line: We could put cybersecurity first if we just make sure the next secretary of state doesn’t have a private server.

name: KAINE
line: A full investigation concluded that not one reasonable prosecutor would take any additional step. You don’t get to decide the rights and wrongs of this. We have a justice system that does that. And a Republican FBI director did an investigation and concluded that…[crosstalk]

name: QUIJANO
line: All right, we are moving on now. Two hundred fifty thousand people…

name: PENCE
line: If your son or my son handled classified information the way Hillary Clinton did…

name: QUIJANO
line: … one hundred thousand of them children — Governor…

name: PENCE
line: … they’d be court martialed.

name: KAINE
line: That is absolutely false and you know that.

name: PENCE
line: Absolutely true.

name: KAINE
line: And you know that, Governor.

name: QUIJANO
line: Governor…

name: PENCE
line: It’s absolutely true.

name: QUIJANO
line: Gentlemen, please.

name: KAINE
line: Because the FBI did an investigation.

name: QUIJANO
line: Gentlemen.

name: KAINE
line: And they concluded that there was no reasonable prosecutor who would take it further. Sorry.

name: QUIJANO
line: Senator Kaine, Governor Pence, please.

name: KAINE
line: Syria.

name: QUIJANO
line: I want to turn now to Syria. Two hundred fifty thousand people, 100,000 of them children, are under siege in Aleppo, Syria. Bunker buster bombs, cluster munitions, and incendiary weapons are being dropped on them by Russian and Syrian militaries. Does the U.S. have a responsibility to protect civilians and prevent mass casualties on this scale, Governor Pence?

name: PENCE
line: The United States of America needs to begin to exercise strong leadership to protect the vulnerable citizens and over 100,000 children in Aleppo. Hillary Clinton’s top priority when she became secretary of state was the Russian reset, the Russian reset. After the Russian reset, the Russians invaded Ukraine and took over Crimea.

name: QUIJANO
line: Governor, your two minutes are up.

name: PENCE
line: We’ve just got to have American strength on the world stage. When Donald Trump becomes president of the United States, the Russians and other countries in the world will know they’re dealing with a strong American president.

name: QUIJANO
line: Senator Kaine?

name: KAINE
line: Hillary and I also agree that the establishment of humanitarian zones in northern Syria with the provision of international human aid, consistent with the U.N. Security Council resolution that was passed in February 2014, would be a very, very good idea.

name: PENCE
line: Well, that offended me.

name: KAINE
line: Governor Pence just said — Governor Pence just said that Donald Trump will rebuild the military. No, he won’t. Donald Trump is avoiding paying taxes. The New York Times story — and we need to get this — but the New York Times suggested that he probably didn’t pay taxes for about 18 years starting in 1995. Those years included the years of 9/11.

name: QUIJANO
line: The question was about Aleppo, Senator.

name: KAINE
line: He wouldn’t support troops. He wouldn’t — he wouldn’t support — this is important, Elaine. When a guy running for president will not support the troops, not support veterans, not support teachers, that’s really important.

name: QUIJANO
line: Right.

name: KAINE
line: And I said about Aleppo, we do agree the notion is we have to create a humanitarian zone in northern Syria. It’s very important.

name: QUIJANO
line: Governor Pence, you had mentioned a no-fly zone. Where would you propose setting up a safe zone specifically? How would you keep it safe?

name: PENCE
line: Well, first and foremost, Donald Trump supports our troops. Donald Trump supports our veterans.

name: KAINE
line: He won’t pay taxes.

name: PENCE
line: Donald Trump has paid all the taxes that he’s — do you not take deductions? How does that work?

name: QUIJANO
line: Gentlemen, this is about Syria. I’d like to…[crosstalk]

name: PENCE
line: Honestly, Senator. Honestly, Senator.

name: KAINE
line: It is about our troops. It is about our troops.

name: PENCE
line: I understand why you want to change — I understand why you want to change the subject.

name: KAINE
line: How can you support the troops if you won’t pay taxes?

name: PENCE
line: I understand why you want to change the subject. And let me be very clear on this Russian thing. The larger question here…

name: KAINE
line: Do you think Donald Trump is smart to not pay taxes?

name: QUIJANO
line: Gentlemen, we’re going to have time to get to Russia here.

name: PENCE
line: What we’re dealing with is the — you know, there’s an old proverb that says the Russian bear never dies, it just hibernates. And the truth of the matter is, the weak and feckless foreign policy of Hillary Clinton and Barack Obama has awakened an aggression in Russia that first appeared a few years ago with their move in Georgia, now their move into Crimea, now their move into the wider Middle East.

name: QUIJANO
line: And exactly how would those safe zones work? How would they remain safe?

name: PENCE
line: The — the safe zones would have to be — as the senator said, there’s already a framework for this that’s been recognized by the international community. The United States of America needs to be prepared to work with our allies in the region to create a route for safe passage and then to protect people in those areas, including with a no-fly zone.

name: KAINE
line: Well, let me — let me come back…

name: PENCE
line: … is deeply troubling to me. That will all change the day Donald Trump becomes president of the United States.

name: KAINE
line: … and talk about — let me talk about the things that Governor Pence doesn’t want to acknowledge, Elaine. He doesn’t want to acknowledge that we stopped the Iranian nuclear weapons program. He doesn’t want to acknowledge…

name: PENCE
line: You didn’t.

name: KAINE
line: … that Hillary was part of the team that got bin Laden. He doesn’t want to acknowledge…

name: PENCE
line: I just did.

name: KAINE
line: … that it’s a good thing, not a bad thing, that it’s a good thing — not a bad thing — that we’re down from 175,000 troops deployed overseas to 15,000.

name: PENCE
line: And come on. Senator. Senator, that was even beneath you and Hillary Clinton. And that — that’s pretty low.

name: KAINE
line: But do you — do you think — do you think we should have — more nuclear weapons in the world will make us safer?

name: PENCE
line: Senator, the…

name: KAINE
line: That’s what Donald Trump thinks.

name: PENCE
line: Ronald Reagan also said nuclear war should never be fought because it can never be won. And the United States of America needs to make investments in modernizing our nuclear force for both deterrence…

name: KAINE
line: But can you defend Donald Trump’s claim that more nations should get nuclear weapons?

name: PENCE
line: … and assurance to our allies. But let me go back to this Iran thing. I mean, he keeps saying that they prevented — that Hillary Clinton started the deal with the Iranians prevented Iran from getting a nuclear weapon.

name: KAINE
line: That’s what the Israeli joint chiefs of staff is saying right now.

name: PENCE
line: Well, that’s not what — that’s not what Israel thinks.

name: KAINE
line: Gadi Eizenkot, you can go check it.

name: PENCE
line: You wouldn’t necessarily know that.

name: KAINE
line: Go to the tape.

name: PENCE
line: I know you boycotted Prime Minister Netanyahu’s speech when he came before the Congress.

name: KAINE
line: No, I visited him in his office. I visited him in his office.

name: PENCE
line: You boycotted the speech. The point is, what this Iran — so-called Iran deal did was essentially guarantee — I mean, when I was in Congress, I fought hard on a bipartisan basis with Republican and Democrat members to move forward the toughest sanctions, it — literally in the history of the United States, against Iran.

name: KAINE
line: And then Hillary used them to get a deal.

name: PENCE
line: We were bringing them to heel, but the goal was always that we would only lift the sanctions if Iran permanently renounced their nuclear ambitions.

name: KAINE
line: Elaine, let me just mention one thing.

name: PENCE
line: They have not — Elaine, let me finish a sentence. They have not renounced their nuclear ambitions. And when the deal’s period runs out, there’s no limitation on them obtaining weapons. That…[crosstalk]

name: QUIJANO
line: And very quickly, Senator.

name: KAINE
line: Elaine…

name: PENCE
line: … and the fact that they got $1.7 billion in a ransom payment…

name: QUIJANO
line: We need to talk about Russia. Very quickly, though, Senator, please.

name: PENCE
line: … is astonishing to the American people.

name: KAINE
line: Six times tonight, I have said to Governor Pence I can’t imagine how you can defend your running mate’s position on one issue after the next. And in all six cases, he’s refused to defend his running mate.

name: PENCE
line: Well, let’s — no, no, don’t put words in my mouth.

name: QUIJANO
line: All right.

name: PENCE
line: He’s going…[crosstalk]

name: KAINE
line: And yet he is asking everybody to vote for somebody that he cannot defend. And I just think that should be underlined.

name: PENCE
line: No, I’m — look…[crosstalk]

name: QUIJANO
line: All right, gentlemen, let’s talk about Russia. This is a topic that has come up.

name: PENCE
line: I’m very, very happy to defend Donald Trump. If he wants to take these one at a time, I’ll take them one at a time.

name: QUIJANO
line: I will give you an opportunity to do that.

name: KAINE
line: More nations should get nuclear weapons. Try to defend that.

name: PENCE
line: Don’t put words in my mouth. Well, he never said that, Senator.

name: KAINE
line: He absolutely said it. Saudi Arabia, South Korea, Japan.

name: PENCE
line: Most of the stuff you’ve said, he’s never said.

name: QUIJANO
line: Gentlemen, Russia. Russian President Vladimir Putin invaded Ukraine, annexed Crimea, and has provided crucial military support to the Assad regime. What steps, if any, would your administration take to counter these actions? Senator Kaine?

name: KAINE
line: You’ve got to be tough on Russia. So let’s start with not praising Vladimir Putin as a great leader. Donald Trump and Mike Pence have said he’s a great leader. And Donald Trump has business…

name: PENCE
line: No, we haven’t.

name: KAINE
line: … has business dealings — has business dealings with Russia that he refuses to disclose. Hillary Clinton has gone toe-to-toe with Russia. She went toe-to-toe with Russia as secretary of state to do the New START Agreement to reduce Russia’s nuclear stockpile. She’s had the experience doing it.

name: PENCE
line: Oh, that’s nonsense.

name: KAINE
line: He was on a TV show a couple months back, and he said, “I’ll guarantee you this, Russia’s not going into the Ukraine.” And he had to be reminded that they had gone into the Crimea two years before.

name: PENCE
line: He knew that.

name: KAINE
line: Hillary Clinton has gone toe-to-toe with Russia to work out a deal on New START. She got them engaged in a meaningful way to cap Iran’s nuclear weapons program. And yet she stood up to them on issues such as Syria and their invasion of Georgia. You’ve got to have the ability to do that, and Hillary does.

name: PENCE
line: But what’s it got to do with Russia?

name: KAINE
line: Every president since Richard Nixon has done it, and Donald Trump has said I’m doing business with Russia. The only way the American public will see whether he has a conflict of interest…

name: PENCE
line: No, he hasn’t said that.

name: KAINE
line: He has, actually.

name: QUIJANO
line: Senator, your time is up. Governor?

name: PENCE
line: Well, thanks. I’m just trying to keep up with the insult-driven campaign on the other side of the table.

name: KAINE
line: You know, I’m just saying facts about your running mate.

name: PENCE
line: Yeah.

name: KAINE
line: And I know you can’t defend.

name: QUIJANO
line: Senator, please. This is the governor’s two minutes.

name: PENCE
line: I’m happy to defend him, Senator. Don’t put words in my mouth that I’m not defending him.

name: KAINE
line: You’re not.

name: PENCE
line: I’m happy to defend him. Most of what you said is completely false, and the American people know that.

name: KAINE
line: I’ll run through the list of things where you won’t defend…

name: PENCE
line: This isn’t the old days where you can just say stuff and people believe it.

name: QUIJANO
line: Senator, please. This is Governor Pence’s two minutes.

name: PENCE
line: Look, this is the alternative universe of Washington, D.C., versus reality. Hillary Clinton said her number-one priority was a reset with Russia. That reset resulted in the invasion of Ukraine, after they’d infiltrated with what are called little green men, Russian soldiers that were dressing up like Ukrainian dissidents, and then they moved all the way into Crimea, took over the Crimean Peninsula. Donald Trump knew that happened. He basically was saying it’s not going to happen again. The truth of the matter is that what you have in the rise of aggressive Russia, which has had — increased its influence in Iran, that’s now — now because of this deal is on a pathway in the future to obtain a nuclear — the leading state sponsor of terror in the world in Iran now has a closer working relationship with Russia because of Hillary Clinton and Barack Obama’s foreign policy and $150 billion and sanctions all being lifted.

name: KAINE
line: We wiped out the leader of Al Qaida.

name: PENCE
line: … on the day that Iran released four American hostages…

name: KAINE
line: We stopped Iran from getting nuclear weapons.

name: QUIJANO
line: Governor…

name: PENCE
line: … we delivered $400 million in cash as a ransom payment for Americans held by the radical mullahs in Tehran.

name: QUIJANO
line: Governor, yesterday, Mr. Trump said…

name: KAINE
line: And we stopped a nuclear weapons program without a shot.

name: QUIJANO
line: … quote, “Putin has no respect for Hillary Clinton and no respect for Obama.” Why do you think he’ll respect a Trump-Pence administration?

name: PENCE
line: Strength. Plain and simple.

name: KAINE
line: Business dealings.

name: PENCE
line: Donald Trump — that’s nonsense. Donald Trump is a strong leader…

name: KAINE
line: Donald Trump’s son says that the Trump organization…

name: PENCE
line: … who is going to lead with American strength.

name: QUIJANO
line: Please, Senator, I’ll give you a chance to respond.

name: PENCE
line: We’re going to rebuild our military. And let me — let me — this whole Putin thing. Look, America is stronger than Russia. Our economy is 16 times larger than the Russian economy. America’s political system is superior to the crony, corrupt capitalist system in Russia in every way.

name: QUIJANO
line: Senator Kaine?

name: PENCE
line: … of Hillary Clinton and Barack Obama.

name: KAINE
line: Well, this is one where we can just kind of go to the tape on it. But Governor Pence said, inarguably, Vladimir Putin is a better leader than President Obama.

name: PENCE
line: That is absolutely inaccurate.

name: KAINE
line: And — and — and I just think a guy who praises…

name: PENCE
line: He said he’s stronger — he’s been stronger on the world stage.

name: KAINE
line: No, he said leader. And if — and I’ll just say this, Governor.

name: PENCE
line: You just said better.

name: KAINE
line: If you mistake leadership for dictatorship, and you can’t tell the difference, a country that’s running its economy into the ground…

name: PENCE
line: Yeah, here we go. This is the grade school thing again?

name: KAINE
line: … persecuting journalists…

name: PENCE
line: Right, this is grade school.

name: KAINE
line: … if you can’t tell the difference, you shouldn’t be commander-in-chief.

name: PENCE
line: Yeah.

name: KAINE
line: And with Donald Trump — Donald Trump’s sons say that they have all these business dealings with Russia. Those could be disclosed with tax returns, but they refuse to do them. Americans need to worry about whether Donald Trump will be watching out for America’s bottom line or his own bottom line.

name: QUIJANO
line: Senator Kaine, what went wrong with the Russia reset?

name: KAINE
line: Vladimir Putin. Vladimir Putin is a dictator.

name: QUIJANO
line: And what would do you differently?

name: KAINE
line: Vladimir Putin is a dictator. He’s not a leader. Anybody who thinks otherwise doesn’t know Russian history and they don’t know Vladimir Putin. Hillary Clinton knows exactly who this guy is. John McCain said, I look in his eyes and I see KGB. And Hillary kind of has that same feeling.

name: PENCE
line: Right.

name: KAINE
line: So how do deal with him? You’ve got to — we do have to deal with Russia in a lot of different ways. There are areas where we can cooperate. So it was Hillary Clinton who worked with Russia on the New START Treaty to reduce their nuclear weapons stockpile. It was Hillary Clinton that worked with Russia to get them engaged in a community of nations to stop the Iranian nuclear weapons program without firing a shot.

name: QUIJANO
line: All right, I’d like to ask now about North Korea, Iran and the threat of nuclear weapons. North Korea recently conducted its fifth and most powerful nuclear test.

name: PENCE
line: Right.

name: QUIJANO
line: What specific steps would you take to prevent North Korea from developing a nuclear-armed missile capable of reaching the United States? Governor Pence?

name: PENCE
line: Well, first, we need to — we need to make a commitment to rebuild our military, including modernizing our nuclear forces. And we also need — we also need an effective American diplomacy that will marshal the resources of nations in the Asian Pacific Rim to put pressure on North Korea, on Kim Jong-un, to abandon his nuclear ambitions. It has to remain the policy of the United States of America the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula, plain and simple.

name: KAINE
line: Until he…[crosstalk]

name: PENCE
line: … done well in some focus group. But here — Hillary Clinton and her husband set up a private foundation called the Clinton Foundation. While she was secretary of state, the Clinton Foundation accepted tens of millions of dollars from foreign governments and foreign donors.

name: QUIJANO
line: Governor, your two minutes are up.

name: PENCE
line: … the reason the American people don’t trust Hillary Clinton is because they are looking at the pay to play politics that she operated with the Clinton Foundation through a private server…

name: QUIJANO
line: Governor, please.

name: PENCE
line: … while she’s secretary of state.

name: QUIJANO
line: Your two minutes are up, Governor.

name: PENCE
line: And they’re saying enough is enough.

name: QUIJANO
line: Senator Kaine?

name: KAINE
line: I’m going to talk about the foundation, and then I’ll talk about North Korea. So, on the foundation. I am glad to talk about the foundation. The Clinton Foundation is one of the highest- rated charities in the world. It provides AIDS drugs to about 11.5 million people. It helps Americans deal with opioid overdoses. It gets higher rankings for its charity than the American Red Cross does. The Clinton Foundation does an awful lot of good work.

name: PENCE
line: The Trump Foundation is a non-profit.

name: KAINE
line: In addition, Donald Trump has a foundation. The foundation was just fined for illegally contributing foundation dollars to a political campaign of a Florida attorney general. They made an illegal contribution, and then they tried to hide it by disguising it to somebody else. And the person they donated to was somebody whose office was charged with investigating Trump University.

name: QUIJANO
line: Governor, I will give you 30 seconds to respond, because I know you want to, but, again, I would remind you both this was about North Korea. [laughter]

name: PENCE
line: Well, thank you. Thank you. The Trump Foundation is a private family foundation. They give virtually every cent in the Trump Foundation to charitable causes.

name: KAINE
line: Political contributions?

name: PENCE
line: Less than ten cents on the dollar in the Clinton Foundation has gone to charitable causes.

name: KAINE
line: A $20,000 portrait of Donald Trump? PENCE: Less than 10 cents on the dollar of the Clinton Foundation has gone to charitable causes.

name: KAINE
line: Ninety percent.

name: PENCE
line: It has been a platform for the Clintons to travel the world, to have staff. But honestly, Senator, we would know a lot more about it if Hillary Clinton would just turn over the 33,000 e-mails…

name: QUIJANO
line: All right, let’s turn back to North Korea…

name: PENCE
line: … that she refused to turn over in her private server…

name: QUIJANO
line: Senator Kaine…

name: PENCE
line: … and we’d have a much better picture of what the Clinton Foundation was about.

name: QUIJANO
line: Senator Kaine, if you had intelligence that North Korea was about to launch a missile, a nuclear-armed missile capable of reaching the United States, would you take preemptive action?

name: KAINE
line: If we — look, a president should take action to defend the United States against imminent threat. You have to. A president has to do that. Now exactly what action, you would have to determine what your intelligence was, how certain you were of that intelligence, but you would have to take action.

name: QUIJANO
line: All right. I’d like to turn to our next segment now. And in this, I’d like to focus on social issues. You have both been open about the role that faith has played in your lives. Can you discuss in detail a time when you struggled to balance your personal faith and a public policy position? Senator Kaine?

name: KAINE
line: Yeah, that’s an easy one for me, Elaine. It’s an easy one. I’m really fortunate. I grew up in a wonderful household with great Irish Catholic parents. My mom and dad are sitting right here. I was educated by Jesuits at Rockhurst High School in Kansas City. My 40th reunion is in 10 days.

name: QUIJANO
line: Governor Pence?

name: PENCE
line: Well, it’s a wonderful question. And my Christian faith is at the very heart of who I am. I was also raised in a wonderful family of faith. It was a church on Sunday morning and grace before dinner.

name: KAINE
line: That’s shared.

name: PENCE
line: But for me, I would tell you that for me the sanctity of life proceeds out of the belief that — that ancient principle that — where God says before you were formed in the womb, I knew you, and so for my first time in public life, I sought to stand with great compassion for the sanctity of life.

name: KAINE
line: Elaine, this is a fundamental question, a fundamental question. Hillary and I are both people out of religious backgrounds, from Methodist church experience, which was really formative for her as a public servant.

name: PENCE
line: No, it’s really not. Donald Trump and I would never support legislation that punished women who made the heartbreaking choice to end a pregnancy.

name: KAINE
line: Then why did Donald Trump say that?

name: PENCE
line: We just never would.

name: KAINE
line: Why did he say that?

name: PENCE
line: Well, look, it’s — look, he’s not a polished politician like you and Hillary Clinton. And so…

name: KAINE
line: Well, I would admit that’s not a polished…[crosstalk]

name: PENCE
line: You know, things don’t always come out exactly the way he means them.

name: KAINE
line: Well, can I say…

name: PENCE
line: But I’m telling you what the policy of our administration would be.

name: KAINE
line: Great line from the — great line from the gospel of Matthew. From the fullness of the heart, the mouth speaks.

name: PENCE
line: Yeah.

name: KAINE
line: When Donald Trump says women should be punished or Mexicans are rapists and criminals…

name: PENCE
line: I’m telling you…

name: KAINE
line: … or John McCain is not a hero, he is showing you who he is.

name: PENCE
line: Senator, you’ve whipped out that Mexican thing again. He — look…

name: KAINE
line: Can you defend it?

name: PENCE
line: There are criminal aliens in this country, Tim, who have come into this country illegally who are perpetrating violence and taking American lives.

name: KAINE
line: You want to — you want to use a big broad brush against Mexicans on that?

name: PENCE
line: He also said and many of them are good people. You keep leaving that out of your quote. And if you want me to go there, I’ll go there.

name: KAINE
line: This is important —

name: PENCE
line: … bring the — let’s welcome the children into our world. There are so many families around the country who can’t have children. We could improve adoption…

name: KAINE
line: But, Governor…

name: PENCE
line: … so that families that can’t have children can adopt more readily those children from crisis pregnancies.

name: KAINE
line: Governor, why don’t you trust women to make this choice for themselves? We can encourage people to support life. Of course we can. But why don’t you trust women? Why doesn’t Donald Trump trust women to make this choice for themselves?

name: PENCE
line: Because there are…

name: KAINE
line: … but on fundamental issues of morality, we should let women make their own decisions.

name: PENCE
line: Because there is — a society can be judged by how it deals with its most vulnerable, the aged, the infirm, the disabled, and the unborn. I believe it with all my heart. And I couldn’t be more proud to be standing with a pro-life candidate in Donald Trump.

name: QUIJANO
line: I do have one final question for you both tonight. It has been a divisive campaign. Senator Kaine, if your ticket wins, what specifically are you going to do to unify the country and reassure the people who voted against you?

name: KAINE
line: That’s a really important one. That may be the $64,000 question, because it has been a divisive campaign. And again, Hillary is running a campaign about stronger together, and Donald Trump — and this is — this is not directed at this man, except to the extent that he can’t defend Donald Trump — Donald Trump has run a campaign that’s been about one insult after the next.

name: QUIJANO
line: Governor, how will you unify the country if you win?

name: PENCE
line: Well, thank you, Elaine, and thanks for a great discussion…

name: KAINE
line: Absolutely.

name: PENCE
line: … tonight. Thank you, Senator.

name: QUIJANO
line: All right, gentlemen, thank you so much.

name: QUIJANO
line: Good evening. From Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia, and welcome to the first, and only, vice presidential debate of 2016, sponsored by the Commission on Presidential Debates.

name: WALLACE
line: Good evening from the Thomas and Mack Center at the University of Nevada, Las Vegas. I’m Chris Wallace of Fox News, and I welcome you to the third and final of the 2016 presidential debates between Secretary of State Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump.

name: CLINTON
line: Thank you very much, Chris. And thanks to UNLV for hosting us.

name: WALLACE
line: Secretary Clinton, thank you.

name: TRUMP
line: Well, first of all, it’s great to be with you, and thank you, everybody. The Supreme Court: It’s what it’s all about. Our country is so, so—it’s just so imperative that we have the right justices.

name: WALLACE
line: Mr. Trump, thank you.

name: CLINTON
line: Well, first of all, I support the Second Amendment. I lived in Arkansas for 18 wonderful years. I represented upstate New York. I understand and respect the tradition of gun ownership. It goes back to the founding of our country.

name: WALLACE
line: Let me bring Mr. Trump in here. The bipartisan Open Debate Coalition got millions of votes on questions to ask here, and this was, in fact, one of the top questions that they got. How will you ensure the Second Amendment is protected? You just heard Secretary Clinton’s answer. Does she persuade you that, while you may disagree on regulation, that, in fact, she supports a Second Amendment right to bear arms?

name: TRUMP
line: Well, the D.C. vs. Heller decision was very strongly—and she was extremely angry about it. I watched. I mean, she was very, very angry when upheld. And Justice Scalia was so involved. And it was a well-crafted decision. But Hillary was extremely upset, extremely angry. And people that believe in the Second Amendment and believe in it very strongly were very upset with what she had to say.

name: WALLACE
line: Well, let me bring in Secretary Clinton. Were you extremely upset?

name: CLINTON
line: Well, I was upset because, unfortunately, dozens of toddlers injure themselves, even kill people with guns, because, unfortunately, not everyone who has loaded guns in their homes takes appropriate precautions.

name: WALLACE
line: Let me bring Mr. Trump back into this, because, in fact, you oppose any limits on assault weapons, any limits on high-capacity magazines. You support a national right to carry law. Why, sir?

name: TRUMP
line: Well, let me just tell you before we go any further. In Chicago, which has the toughest gun laws in the United States, probably you could say by far, they have more gun violence than any other city. So we have the toughest laws, and you have tremendous gun violence.

name: WALLACE
line: Well, let’s pick up on another issue which divides you and the justices that whoever ends up winning this election appoints could have a dramatic effect there, and that’s the issue of abortion.

name: TRUMP
line: Right.

name: WALLACE
line: Mr. Trump, you’re pro-life. But I want to ask you specifically: Do you want the court, including the justices that you will name, to overturn Roe v. Wade, which includes—in fact, states—a woman’s right to abortion?

name: TRUMP
line: Well, if that would happen, because I am pro-life, and I will be appointing pro-life judges, I would think that that will go back to the individual states.

name: WALLACE
line: But I’m asking you specifically. Would you like to…

name: TRUMP
line: If they overturned it, it will go back to the states.

name: WALLACE
line: But what I’m asking you, sir, is, do you want to see the court overturn—you just said you want to see the court protect the Second Amendment. Do you want to see the court overturn Roe v. Wade?

name: TRUMP
line: Well, if we put another two or perhaps three justices on, that’s really what’s going to be—that will happen. And that’ll happen automatically, in my opinion, because I am putting pro-life justices on the court. I will say this: It will go back to the states, and the states will then make a determination.

name: WALLACE
line: Secretary Clinton?

name: CLINTON
line: Well, I strongly support Roe v. Wade, which guarantees a constitutional right to a woman to make the most intimate, most difficult, in many cases, decisions about her health care that one can imagine. And in this case, it’s not only about Roe v. Wade. It is about what’s happening right now in America.

name: WALLACE
line: Secretary Clinton…

name: CLINTON
line: And we have come too far to have that turned back now. And, indeed, he said women should be punished, that there should be some form of punishment for women who obtain abortions. And I could just not be more opposed to that kind of thinking.

name: WALLACE
line: I’m going to give you a chance to respond, but I want to ask you, Secretary Clinton, I want to explore how far you believe the right to abortion goes. You have been quoted as saying that the fetus has no constitutional rights. You also voted against a ban on late-term, partial-birth abortions. Why?

name: CLINTON
line: Because Roe v. Wade very clearly sets out that there can be regulations on abortion so long as the life and the health of the mother are taken into account. And when I voted as a senator, I did not think that that was the case.

name: WALLACE
line: Mr. Trump, your reaction? And particularly on this issue of late-term, partial-birth abortions.

name: TRUMP
line: Well, I think it’s terrible. If you go with what Hillary is saying, in the ninth month, you can take the baby and rip the baby out of the womb of the mother just prior to the birth of the baby.

name: CLINTON
line: Well, that is not what happens in these cases. And using that kind of scare rhetoric is just terribly unfortunate. You should meet with some of the women that I have met with, women I have known over the course of my life. This is one of the worst possible choices that any woman and her family has to make. And I do not believe the government should be making it.

name: WALLACE
line: All right. But just briefly, I want to move on to another segment…

name: TRUMP
line: And, honestly, nobody has business doing what I just said, doing that, as late as one or two or three or four days prior to birth. Nobody has that.

name: WALLACE
line: All right. Let’s move on to the subject of immigration. And there is almost no issue that separates the two of you more than the issue of immigration. Actually, there are a lot of issues that separate the two of you.

name: TRUMP
line: Well, first of all, she wants to give amnesty, which is a disaster and very unfair to all of the people that are waiting in line for many, many years. We need strong borders.

name: WALLACE
line: Mr. Trump, thank you. Same question to you, Secretary Clinton. Basically, why are you right and Mr. Trump is wrong?

name: CLINTON
line: Well, as he was talking, I was thinking about a young girl I met here in Las Vegas, Carla, who is very worried that her parents might be deported, because she was born in this country but they were not. They work hard, they do everything they can to give her a good life.

name: WALLACE
line: Thank you, Secretary Clinton. I want to follow up…

name: TRUMP
line: Chris, I think it’s…

name: WALLACE
line: OK.

name: TRUMP
line: I think I should respond to that. First of all, I had a very good meeting with the president of Mexico. Very nice man. We will be doing very much better with Mexico on trade deals. Believe me. The NAFTA deal signed by her husband is one of the worst deals ever made of any kind, signed by anybody. It’s a disaster.

name: WALLACE
line: Well, let me—wait, wait, sir, let me…

name: TRUMP
line: We are a country of laws. We either have—and by the way…

name: WALLACE
line: Now, wait. I’d like to hear from…

name: TRUMP
line: Well—well, but she said one thing.

name: WALLACE
line: I’d like to hear—I’d like to hear from Secretary Clinton.

name: CLINTON
line: I voted for border security, and there are…

name: TRUMP
line: And the wall.

name: CLINTON
line: There are some limited places where that was appropriate. There also is necessarily going to be new technology and how best to deploy that.

name: WALLACE
line: Mr. Trump?

name: TRUMP
line: President Obama has moved millions of people out. Nobody knows about it, nobody talks about it. But under Obama, millions of people have been moved out of this country. They’ve been deported. She doesn’t want to say that, but that’s what’s happened, and that’s what happened big league.

name: WALLACE
line: I want to…

name: TRUMP
line: But what she doesn’t say is that President Obama has deported millions and millions of people just the way it is.

name: WALLACE
line: Secretary Clinton, I want to…

name: CLINTON
line: We will not have open borders. That is…

name: WALLACE
line: Well, let me—Secretary…

name: CLINTON
line: That is a rank mischaracterization.

name: WALLACE
line: Secretary Clinton…

name: CLINTON
line: We will have secure borders, but we’ll also have reform. And this used to be a bipartisan issue. Ronald Reagan was the last president…

name: WALLACE
line: Secretary Clinton, excuse me. Secretary Clinton.

name: CLINTON
line: … to sign immigration reform, and George W. Bush supported it, as well.

name: WALLACE
line: Secretary Clinton, I want to clear up your position on this issue, because in a speech you gave to a Brazilian bank, for which you were paid $225,000, we’ve learned from the WikiLeaks, that you said this, and I want to quote. “My dream is a hemispheric common market with open trade and open borders.” So that’s the question…

name: TRUMP
line: Thank you.

name: WALLACE
line: That’s the question. Please quiet, everybody. Is that your dream, open borders?

name: CLINTON
line: Well, if you went on to read the rest of the sentence, I was talking about energy. You know, we trade more energy with our neighbors than we trade with the rest of the world combined. And I do want us to have an electric grid, an energy system that crosses borders. I think that would be a great benefit to us.

name: WALLACE
line: Well?

name: TRUMP
line: That was a great pivot off the fact that she wants open borders, OK? How did we get on to Putin?

name: WALLACE
line: Hold on—hold on, wait. Hold on, folks. Because we—this is going to end up getting out of control. Let’s try to keep it quiet so—for the candidates and for the American people.

name: TRUMP
line: So just to finish on the borders…

name: WALLACE
line: Yes?

name: TRUMP
line: She wants open borders. People are going to pour into our country. People are going to come in from Syria. She wants 550 percent more people than Barack Obama, and he has thousands and thousands of people. They have no idea where they come from.

name: WALLACE
line: Wait, but…

name: TRUMP
line: … from everything I see, has no respect for this person.

name: CLINTON
line: Well, that’s because he’d rather have a puppet as president of the United States.

name: TRUMP
line: No puppet. No puppet.

name: CLINTON
line: And it’s pretty clear…

name: TRUMP
line: You’re the puppet!

name: CLINTON
line: It’s pretty clear you won’t admit…

name: TRUMP
line: No, you’re the puppet.

name: CLINTON
line: … that the Russians have engaged in cyberattacks against the United States of America, that you encouraged espionage against our people, that you are willing to spout the Putin line, sign up for his wish list, break up NATO, do whatever he wants to do, and that you continue to get help from him, because he has a very clear favorite in this race.

name: WALLACE
line: Secretary Clinton…

name: CLINTON
line: And I think it’s time you take a stand…

name: TRUMP
line: She has no idea whether it’s Russia, China, or anybody else.

name: CLINTON
line: I am not quoting myself.

name: TRUMP
line: She has no idea.

name: CLINTON
line: I am quoting 17…

name: TRUMP
line: Hillary, you have no idea.

name: CLINTON
line: … 17 intelligence—do you doubt 17 military and civilian…

name: TRUMP
line: And our country has no idea.

name: CLINTON
line: … agencies.

name: TRUMP
line: Yeah, I doubt it. I doubt it.

name: CLINTON
line: Well, he’d rather believe Vladimir Putin than the military and civilian intelligence professionals who are sworn to protect us. I find that just absolutely…[crosstalk]

name: TRUMP
line: She doesn’t like Putin because Putin has outsmarted her at every step of the way.

name: WALLACE
line: Mr. Trump…

name: TRUMP
line: Excuse me. Putin has outsmarted her in Syria.

name: WALLACE
line: Mr. Trump…[crosstalk]

name: TRUMP
line: He’s outsmarted her every step of the way.

name: WALLACE
line: I’m not a potted plant here, I do get to ask some questions.

name: TRUMP
line: Yes, that’s fine.

name: WALLACE
line: And I would like to ask you this direct question. The top national security officials of this country do believe that Russia has been behind these hacks. Even if you don’t know for sure whether they are, do you condemn any interference by Russia in the American election?

name: TRUMP
line: By Russia or anybody else.

name: WALLACE
line: You condemn their interference?

name: TRUMP
line: Of course I condemn. Of course I—I don’t know Putin. I have no idea.

name: WALLACE
line: I’m not asking—I’m asking do you condemn?

name: TRUMP
line: I never met Putin. This is not my best friend. But if the United States got along with Russia, wouldn’t be so bad.

name: WALLACE
line: We’re a long way away from immigration, but I’m going to let you finish this topic. You got about 45 seconds.

name: TRUMP
line: And she always will be.

name: CLINTON
line: I—I find it ironic that he’s raising nuclear weapons. This is a person who has been very cavalier, even casual about the use of nuclear weapons. He’s…

name: TRUMP
line: Wrong.

name: CLINTON
line: … advocated more countries getting them, Japan, Korea, even Saudi Arabia. He said, well, if we have them, why don’t we use them, which I think is terrifying.

name: TRUMP
line: I have 200 generals…

name: WALLACE
line: Very quickly.

name: TRUMP
line: … and admirals, 21 endorsing me, 21 congressional Medal of Honor recipients. As far as Japan and other countries, we are being ripped off by everybody in the—we’re defending other countries. We are spending a fortune doing it. They have the bargain of the century.

name: WALLACE
line: OK.

name: TRUMP
line: Look, she’s been proven to be a liar on so many different ways. This is just another lie.

name: CLINTON
line: Well, I’m just quoting you when you were asked…

name: TRUMP
line: There’s no quote. You’re not going to find a quote from me.

name: CLINTON
line: … about a potential nuclear—nuclear competition in Asia, you said, you know, go ahead, enjoy yourselves, folks. That kind…

name: TRUMP
line: And defend yourselves.

name: CLINTON
line: … of language—well…

name: TRUMP
line: And defend yourselves. I didn’t say nuclear. And defend yourself.

name: CLINTON
line: The United States has kept the peace—the United States has kept the peace through our alliances. Donald wants to tear up our alliances. I think it makes the world safer and, frankly, it makes the United States safer. I would work with our allies in Asia, in Europe, in the Middle East, and elsewhere. That’s the only way we’re going to be able to keep the peace.

name: WALLACE
line: We’re going to—no, we are going to move on to the next topic, which is the economy. And I hope we handle that as well as we did immigration. You also have very different ideas about how to get the economy growing faster. Secretary Clinton, in your plan, government plays a big role. You see more government spending, more entitlements, more tax credits, more tax penalties. Mr. Trump, you want to get government out with lower taxes and less regulation.

name: TRUMP
line: Yes.

name: WALLACE
line: We’re going to drill down into this a little bit more. But in this overview, please explain to me why you believe that your plan will create more jobs and growth for this country and your opponent’s plan will not. In this round, you go first, Secretary Clinton.

name: CLINTON
line: Well, I think when the middle class thrives, America thrives. And so my plan is based on growing the economy, giving middle-class families many more opportunities. I want us to have the biggest jobs program since World War II, jobs in infrastructure and advanced manufacturing. I think we can compete with high-wage countries, and I believe we should. New jobs and clean energy, not only to fight climate change, which is a serious problem, but to create new opportunities and new businesses.

name: WALLACE
line: Secretary, thank you. Mr. Trump, why will your plan create more jobs and growth than Secretary Clinton’s?

name: TRUMP
line: Well, first of all, before I start on my plan, her plan is going to raise taxes and even double your taxes. Her tax plan is a disaster. And she can say all she wants about college tuition. And I’m a big proponent. We’re going to do a lot of things for college tuition. But the rest of the public’s going to be paying for it. We will have a massive, massive tax increase under Hillary Clinton’s plan.

name: WALLACE
line: Time, Mr. Trump.

name: TRUMP
line: … that’s offshore back into the country. We are going to start the engine rolling again, because…

name: WALLACE
line: Mr. Trump?

name: TRUMP
line: … right now, our country is dying at 1 percent GDP.

name: CLINTON
